modules.comments:
Tick Coordinator

A unified animation coordinator that owns the RAF loop and routes ticks
to multiple consumers (transitions, simulations, etc).

Key concepts:
- **Single RAF loop**: One coordinator per visualization, no competing frames
- **TickConsumer**: Anything that needs ticks (transitions, simulations)
- **Pull model**: Consumers compute on tick, coordinator reads results

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Transition.Coordinator as C

main = do
  coord <- C.create

  -- Register a transition
  transitionId <- C.register coord
    { tick: \dt -> do
        -- advance transition
        pure C.StillRunning
    , onComplete: log "done!"
    }

  -- Start the loop
  C.start coord
```

declarations.comments: The tick coordinator - owns the RAF loop
declarations.title: Coordinator

declarations.comments:
Create a new coordinator.
The coordinator starts in stopped state - call `start` to begin.
declarations.title: create

declarations.comments:
Start the animation loop.
Does nothing if already running.
declarations.title: start

declarations.comments:
Stop the animation loop.
Consumers remain registered but stop receiving ticks.
declarations.title: stop

declarations.comments: Check if the coordinator is currently running.
declarations.title: isRunning

declarations.comments: Unique identifier for a registered consumer
declarations.title: ConsumerId

declarations.comments: Result of a tick - tells coordinator what to do next
declarations.title: TickResult

declarations.comments: A tick consumer - anything that needs animation frames
declarations.title: Consumer

declarations.comments:
Register a consumer to receive ticks.
Returns an ID that can be used to unregister later.
If the coordinator is running, the consumer starts receiving ticks immediately.
declarations.title: register

declarations.comments:
Unregister a consumer. It will no longer receive ticks.
If this was the last consumer, the loop continues but does nothing.
declarations.title: unregister

declarations.comments: Time delta in milliseconds
declarations.title: Milliseconds

modules.name: Hylograph.Transition.Coordinator

modules.comments:
Easing Types

An enumeration of all supported easing functions with runtime selection.
This module complements Hylograph.Transition.Tick by providing a data type
that can be stored, serialized, and used for UI selection.

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Transition.Easing (EasingType(..), toFunction)
import Hylograph.Transition.Tick (lerp, withEasing)

-- Store easing preference
type Config = { easing :: EasingType, duration :: Int }

-- Apply at runtime
animate config progress =
  withEasing (toFunction config.easing) (lerp 0.0 100.0) progress
```

declarations.comments:
Enumeration of all easing types
Organized by category for UI presentation
declarations.title: EasingType

declarations.comments: Convert EasingType to the actual easing function
declarations.title: toFunction

declarations.comments: All easing types in order (for populating dropdowns, etc.)
declarations.title: allEasingTypes

declarations.comments: Human-readable label for each easing type
declarations.title: easingLabel

declarations.comments: Category for grouping in UI
declarations.title: easingCategory

modules.name: Hylograph.Transition.Easing

modules.comments:
Transition Engine

A tick-driven transition engine for managing animated state changes.
This provides a framework-agnostic way to animate values over time,
suitable for both Halogen and React integrations.

Key concepts:
- **TransitionSpec**: Defines what to animate (from/to values, duration, easing)
- **TransitionState**: Current state of an in-flight transition
- **TransitionGroup**: Manages multiple coordinated transitions

Design goals:
- Pure, deterministic state updates (no side effects)
- Works with any tick source (simulation tick, RAF, manual)
- Composable with existing Hylograph infrastructure

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Transition.Engine as E
import Hylograph.Transition.Easing (EasingType(..))

-- Create a transition spec
let spec = E.transition
      { from: 0.0, to: 100.0 }
      { duration: 500.0, easing: QuadOut }

-- Start the transition
let state = E.start spec

-- In tick handler: advance by delta (milliseconds)
let state' = E.tick 16.67 state

-- Get current value
let current = E.currentValue state'
```

declarations.comments:
Specification for a transition
Defines the start/end values and how to get there
declarations.title: TransitionSpec

declarations.comments: Configuration for a transition
declarations.title: TransitionConfig

declarations.comments:
Create a transition spec for Numbers
Uses linear interpolation by default
declarations.title: transition

declarations.comments: Create a transition spec with custom interpolation
declarations.title: transitionWith

declarations.comments: Add a delay to a transition spec
declarations.title: withDelay

declarations.comments: State of an active transition
declarations.title: TransitionState

declarations.comments: Start a transition from the beginning
declarations.title: start

declarations.comments: Advance a transition by a time delta (in milliseconds)
declarations.title: tick

declarations.comments:
Advance a transition by a time delta (in milliseconds)
Alias for tick with clearer name
declarations.title: tickBy

declarations.comments: Get the current interpolated value
declarations.title: currentValue

declarations.comments: Get the current progress (0.0 to 1.0)
declarations.title: currentProgress

declarations.comments: Check if the transition is complete
declarations.title: isComplete

declarations.comments: Get remaining time in milliseconds
declarations.title: remaining

declarations.comments:
A group of coordinated transitions that tick together
Useful for animating multiple properties in sync
declarations.title: TransitionGroup

declarations.comments: Create a group from multiple transition specs
declarations.title: group

declarations.comments: Tick all transitions in a group
declarations.title: groupTick

declarations.comments: Get current values from all transitions in group
declarations.title: groupValues

declarations.comments: Check if all transitions in group are complete
declarations.title: groupComplete

declarations.comments: Get maximum remaining time in group
declarations.title: groupRemaining

declarations.comments:
Create a staggered group from multiple value pairs
Each transition animates between its own from/to values with staggered timing

Example:
```purescript
let specs = staggeredGroup
      [{ from: 0.0, to: 100.0 }, { from: 50.0, to: 150.0 }]
      50.0
      { duration: 300.0, easing: QuadOut }
```
declarations.title: staggeredGroup

declarations.comments:
Create staggered specs from a base spec and count
Each transition gets an additional delay based on its index

Example: staggeredSpecs 5 50.0 baseSpec
  -> 5 specs with delays 0ms, 50ms, 100ms, 150ms, 200ms
declarations.title: staggeredSpecs

declarations.comments: A transition with its associated index (for tracking which element it belongs to)
declarations.title: IndexedTransition

declarations.comments: Newtype for indexed transition groups
declarations.title: IndexedTransitionGroup

declarations.comments:
Create a staggered group that tracks element indices
Useful when you need to know which value corresponds to which data element
declarations.title: staggeredGroupIndexed

declarations.comments: Tick all transitions in an indexed group
declarations.title: indexedGroupTick

declarations.comments: Get current values with their indices
declarations.title: indexedValues

declarations.comments: Check if all transitions in indexed group are complete
declarations.title: indexedGroupComplete

declarations.comments: Get maximum remaining time in indexed group
declarations.title: indexedGroupRemaining

declarations.comments: Default configuration: 300ms, QuadOut, no delay
declarations.title: defaultConfig

declarations.comments: Duration in milliseconds
declarations.title: Milliseconds

modules.name: Hylograph.Transition.Engine

modules.comments:
Value Interpolation

Type-safe interpolation functions for various value types.
Used with easing functions from Hylograph.Transition.Tick to create
smooth transitions.

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Transition.Interpolate as I
import Hylograph.Transition.Tick (easeOutQuad, withEasing)

-- Interpolate a color with easing
let color = withEasing easeOutQuad (I.lerpRGB red blue) progress

-- Interpolate a point
let pos = I.lerpPoint origin target progress
```

declarations.comments: 2D point
declarations.title: Point

declarations.comments: Linear interpolation between two points
declarations.title: lerpPoint

declarations.comments: Interpolate x and y separately (for asymmetric easing)
declarations.title: lerpPointXY

declarations.comments: RGB color with components in 0-255 range
declarations.title: RGB

declarations.comments:
Linear interpolation in RGB space
Note: For perceptually uniform transitions, consider lerpHSL
declarations.title: lerpRGB

declarations.comments: Convert RGB to CSS color string
declarations.title: rgbToCSS

declarations.comments:
Parse CSS rgb() or hex color to RGB
Supports: rgb(r,g,b), #RRGGBB, #RGB
declarations.title: cssToRGB

declarations.comments:
HSL color
h: hue in degrees (0-360)
s: saturation (0-1)
l: lightness (0-1)
declarations.title: HSL

declarations.comments:
Linear interpolation in HSL space
Takes the shortest path around the hue circle
declarations.title: lerpHSL

declarations.comments: Convert HSL to CSS color string
declarations.title: hslToCSS

declarations.comments: Convert HSL to RGB
declarations.title: hslToRGB

declarations.comments: Convert RGB to HSL
declarations.title: rgbToHSL

declarations.comments: Typeclass for types that can be interpolated
declarations.title: Interpolatable

declarations.comments: An interpolation function between two values
declarations.title: Interpolator

declarations.comments: Create an interpolator that captures the start and end values
declarations.title: makeInterpolator

modules.name: Hylograph.Transition.Interpolate

modules.comments:
RequestAnimationFrame bindings

Provides browser animation frame timing for tick-based animations.

declarations.comments: Opaque ID for a scheduled animation frame
declarations.title: AnimationFrameId

declarations.comments: High-resolution timestamp in milliseconds
declarations.title: Timestamp

declarations.comments: Schedule a callback for the next animation frame.
declarations.title: requestAnimationFrame

declarations.comments: Cancel a scheduled animation frame.
declarations.title: cancelAnimationFrame

declarations.comments: Get current high-resolution timestamp.
declarations.title: performanceNow

modules.name: Hylograph.Transition.RAF

modules.comments:
Tick-Driven Transitions

Primitives for animating transitions using simulation ticks rather than CSS.
This is the simulation-aware analog to d3-transition.

Key insight: Force simulations already have a tick loop. We can use that
same loop to drive enter/exit/update animations, giving us:
- Predictable, debuggable behavior
- No CSS timing coordination
- Pure PureScript interpolation

Usage:
```purescript
import Hylograph.Transition.Tick as T

-- In your state
type State = { entering :: Map String Progress, exiting :: Array (Transitioning Node) }

-- In tick handler
onTick state = do
  let { active: stillEntering } = T.tickProgressMap 0.025 state.entering
  let { active: stillExiting } = T.tickTransitions 0.025 state.exiting
  -- render with interpolated values

-- In render
radius = case enterProgress of
  Just p -> T.lerp 20.0 5.0 (T.easeOut p)
  Nothing -> 5.0
```

declarations.comments: Progress from 0.0 (start) to 1.0 (complete)
declarations.title: Progress

declarations.comments:
Amount to advance progress each tick
At 60fps: 0.025  40 ticks  0.67 seconds
At 60fps: 0.020  50 ticks  0.83 seconds
At 60fps: 0.015  67 ticks  1.1 seconds
declarations.title: TickDelta

declarations.comments: An item in transition, carrying its state and progress
declarations.title: Transitioning

declarations.comments: Easing function: maps linear progress to eased progress
declarations.title: Easing

declarations.comments:
Advance all progress values in a Map, partitioning into active and completed

```purescript
let { active, completed } = tickProgressMap 0.025 enteringNodes
-- active: nodes still animating
-- completed: keys that just finished (for cleanup, callbacks, etc.)
```
declarations.title: tickProgressMap

declarations.comments: Start tracking progress for new keys (from 0.0)
declarations.title: startProgress

declarations.comments: Start tracking progress for new keys from a specific value
declarations.title: startProgressFrom

declarations.comments:
Advance all transitions, partitioning into active and completed

```purescript
let { active, completed } = tickTransitions 0.025 exitingNodes
-- active: items still animating out
-- completed: items that finished (now safe to remove from DOM)
```
declarations.title: tickTransitions

declarations.comments: Wrap items as transitions starting at progress 0.0
declarations.title: startTransitions

declarations.comments: Wrap items as transitions starting at a specific progress
declarations.title: startTransitionsFrom

declarations.comments:
Linear interpolation between two numbers

```purescript
lerp 0.0 100.0 0.5  -- 50.0
lerp 20.0 5.0 1.0   -- 5.0 (shrink from 20 to 5)
```
declarations.title: lerp

declarations.comments: Linear interpolation with progress clamped to [0, 1]
declarations.title: lerpClamped

declarations.comments: Linear interpolation for integers
declarations.title: lerpInt

declarations.comments: No easing (linear)
declarations.title: linear

declarations.comments: Ease in (slow start, fast end) - alias for easeInQuad
declarations.title: easeIn

declarations.comments: Ease out (fast start, slow end) - alias for easeOutQuad
declarations.title: easeOut

declarations.comments: Ease in-out (slow start and end) - alias for easeInOutQuad
declarations.title: easeInOut

declarations.comments: Quadratic ease in: t
declarations.title: easeInQuad

declarations.comments: Quadratic ease out: 1 - (1-t)
declarations.title: easeOutQuad

declarations.comments: Quadratic ease in-out
declarations.title: easeInOutQuad

declarations.comments: Cubic ease in: t
declarations.title: easeInCubic

declarations.comments: Cubic ease out: 1 - (1-t)
declarations.title: easeOutCubic

declarations.comments: Cubic ease in-out
declarations.title: easeInOutCubic

declarations.comments: Sinusoidal ease in: 1 - cos(t * /2)
declarations.title: easeInSin

declarations.comments: Sinusoidal ease out: sin(t * /2)
declarations.title: easeOutSin

declarations.comments: Sinusoidal ease in-out: -(cos( * t) - 1) / 2
declarations.title: easeInOutSin

declarations.comments: Exponential ease in: 2^(10 * (t - 1))
declarations.title: easeInExp

declarations.comments: Exponential ease out: 1 - 2^(-10 * t)
declarations.title: easeOutExp

declarations.comments: Exponential ease in-out
declarations.title: easeInOutExp

declarations.comments: Circular ease in: 1 - sqrt(1 - t)
declarations.title: easeInCircle

declarations.comments: Circular ease out: sqrt(1 - (t - 1))
declarations.title: easeOutCircle

declarations.comments: Circular ease in-out
declarations.title: easeInOutCircle

declarations.comments: Back ease in: overshoots then returns
declarations.title: easeInBack

declarations.comments: Back ease out: overshoots past target then settles
declarations.title: easeOutBack

declarations.comments: Back ease in-out: overshoots on both ends
declarations.title: easeInOutBack

declarations.comments: Elastic ease in: spring-like start
declarations.title: easeInElastic

declarations.comments: Elastic ease out: spring-like end (most common)
declarations.title: easeOutElastic

declarations.comments: Elastic ease in-out: spring on both ends
declarations.title: easeInOutElastic

declarations.comments: Bounce ease in: reverse of bounce out
declarations.title: easeInBounce

declarations.comments: Bounce ease out: ball bouncing to rest
declarations.title: easeOutBounce

declarations.comments: Bounce ease in-out: bounce on both ends
declarations.title: easeInOutBounce

declarations.comments:
Apply easing to an interpolation function

```purescript
-- Ease-out shrink from 20 to 5
radius = withEasing easeOut (lerp 20.0 5.0) progress
```
declarations.title: withEasing

declarations.comments:
Calculate tick delta for a desired duration at assumed 60fps

```purescript
ticksForDuration 1000  -- 0.0167 (1 second at 60fps)
ticksForDuration 500   -- 0.0333 (0.5 seconds)
```
declarations.title: ticksForDuration
